intro: Parosela dalea var. robusta, commonly known as the robust parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
